New Records: New York Yankees' lineup combined for zero walks, zero extra-base hits, and 14-plus strikeouts in a game never seen before in the franchise's 122 years of existence.
Key Match Events: Gleyber Torres got a single off Seth Lugo to open the bottom of the first, but Lugo immediately bounced back with a pair of strikeouts and got out of the inning unscathed.
Torres came through with another single in the seventh, but Lugo added two more strikeouts to escape the jam.
Kris Bubic relieved Lugo in the eighth, retiring the side with two strikeouts, then John Schreiber did the same to close things out in the ninth.
Post-Match Reflections: Even with the loss, the Yankees held onto the top spot in the AL East by 0.5 games.
They are just 4-6 in their last 10 games, though, slowing down instead of hitting their stride with the playoffs fast approaching.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Every member of New York's starting lineup struck out at least once, with five of the nine striking out multiple times.
Aaron Judge, Juan Soto, Giancarlo Stanton, Jazz Chisholm Jr., Jasson Dom√≠nguez, Anthony Rizzo, and Anthony Volpe went 0-for-23 with 12 strikeouts between the seven of them.
Others: The Royals won 5-0, while the Yankees posted a stat line never seen before in the franchise's 122 years of existence.
New York and Kansas City are scheduled for close out their series at 7:05 p.m. ET on Wednesday.
